thread.title: Preston boss Simon Grayson warns Arsenal that North End are 'the real Invincibles' ahead of FA Cup showdown
thread.title_full: Preston boss Simon Grayson warns Arsenal that North End are 'the real Invincibles' ahead of FA Cup showdown

author: Ian Baker
title: Preston boss Simon Grayson warns Arsenal that North End are 'the real Invincibles' ahead of FA Cup showdown
text:
Sport Preston boss Simon Grayson warns Arsenal that North End are 'the real Invincibles' ahead of FA Cup showdown Arsenal famously went the whole of the 2003-04 Premier League season unbeaten but Preston were the first side to achieve the feat right back in 1888-1889 Share Grayson hopes Preston can secure a memorable upset (Photo: Getty) Share Get Arsenal FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Preston boss Simon Grayson has taunted Arsenal ahead of Saturday's Deepdale clash by claiming: 'We're the real Invincibles.' 
Arsene Wenger's side famously went the whole of the 2003-04 unbeaten. But North End achieved that feat first in the Football League's maiden campaign 1888-1889. 
And Grayson said: "People probably only remember the modern day Invincibles but ultimately this football club had the original Invincibles who did so well winning the FA Cup and the league in the first season. 
"It's all about the past and the present but ultimately it's about a group of players on Saturday night going out to get the best out of our group, and ask questions of them. Arsenal achieved the unthinkable in 2004 (Photo: Getty) Preston's Callum Robinson celebrates (Photo: Getty) 
"Obviously we are aware of their strengths and weaknesses but ultimately we will just go and enjoy it and see where it takes us." 
Grayson was a 27-year-old playing for Leicester when Wenger first arrived in English football in 1996. 
And he said: "From a personal point of view I am going to be up against a manager who has graced the Premier League for 20-odd years. Grayson on the touchline (Photo: Serena Taylor) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
